burlap.behavior.functionapproximation.dense.rbf

Class RBFFeatures

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.functionapproximation.dense.rbf.RBFFeatures
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DenseStateFeatures

    public class RBFFeatures
extends Object
implements DenseStateFeatures
    A feature database of RBF units that can be used for linear value function approximation. This class takes as input a DenseStateFeatures object so that states are first converted to a double array and then provided to RBF objects that operate directly on the feature vector of the state.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Map<Action,Integer> actionFeatureMultiplier
      A map for returning a multiplier to the number of RBF state features for each action.
      protected boolean hasOffset
      Specifies whether an offset RBF unit with a constant response value is included in the feature set.
      protected DenseStateFeatures inputFeatures
      The input features over which RBFs will be generated
      protected int nextActionMultiplier
      The next action RBF size multiplier to use for the next newly seen action.
      protected int nRbfs
      The number of RBF units, not including an offset unit.
      protected List<RBF> rbfs
      The list of RBF units in this database

      RBFFeatures(DenseStateFeatures inputFeatures, boolean hasOffset)
      Initializes with an empty list of RBF units.

      Returns a copy of this DenseStateFeatures

    • Field Detail

      • inputFeatures

        protected DenseStateFeatures inputFeatures
        The input features over which RBFs will be generated

      • rbfs

        protected List<RBF> rbfs
        The list of RBF units in this database

      • nRbfs

        protected int nRbfs
        The number of RBF units, not including an offset unit.

      • hasOffset

        protected boolean hasOffset
        Specifies whether an offset RBF unit with a constant response value is included in the feature set.

      • actionFeatureMultiplier

        protected Map<Action,Integer> actionFeatureMultiplier
        A map for returning a multiplier to the number of RBF state features for each action. Effectively this ensures a unique feature ID for each RBF for each action.

      • nextActionMultiplier

        protected int nextActionMultiplier
        The next action RBF size multiplier to use for the next newly seen action.

                   boolean hasOffset)
        Initializes with an empty list of RBF units.
        Parameters:
        inputFeatures - the input features over which RBFs will be generated
        hasOffset - if true, an offset RBF unit with a constant response value is included in the feature set.
